results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Robyn Cooney, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: Miss Mrs and Myths (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
This program looks closely at the wide range of myths and attitudes of contemporary society toward women as members of the workforce. The historical precedents for current attitudes are revealed, and facts, opinions and testimonies are presented to counter the claims of myths.

Originally produced: Adelaide : Open College of Further Education, 1979.
Women as workers (Miss, Mrs, myths) producer, Kay Hannaford ; script, Cate Kelly and Kay Hannaford.

results.title: Hockey one hockey two
results.brief_description: Former Australian International Hockey player Margaret Pierce demonstrates basic skills. In this film Margaret demonstrates the three types of dribbling in Hockey-close, loose and Indian. Aimed at the beginner to intermediate hockey students to improve their skills

results.title: Farm machinery safety
results.creator_credit: Reg Barrett, Allen Keen and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film examines safety factors relating to farm machinery. The film outlines safety features of tractors, including overhead protective frames, guards, maintenance, braking, safety belts and hitching, as well as the importance of guards on a variety of large pieces of farm machinery. The footage includes tractors being used on the farm and examples of common accidents that can occur, inlcuding several scenes of tractors overturning in the field. Of particular interest are the examples of machinery used in the 1960s, including Ford and Massey-Ferguson tractors, the footage of testing on Rheem overhead protective frames and scenes of large dairy farms in New South Wales.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry and presented by the Rural Safety Advisory Service.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: A Banking career
results.creator_credit: Harley H. Davidson, Frederick Daniel and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the various functions of a bank; the daily routine of business, and the responsibility of various bank officers. The latter part of the film lists the various advantages of making banking a career, mentioning rates of pay, special bonuses, opportunities for advancement, medical and sick leave benefits, pensions on retirement and the social life among bank personnel.

results.title: Capricorn charter
results.creator_credit: Frank Killian, Movietone Productions and Queensland Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist features of the central coast of Queensland, with scenes around Rockhampton, Heron, Great Keppel and Quoin Islands, Yeppoon, Emu Park, Gladstone, Emerald and the Mount Morgan Mines.
